section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Paul Masalsky, Yahoo! DITA Users Group

section.lq:
I found that sharing an internal document could be problematic. In lieu of that, here are some suggestions that could help. I'll give a few raster image suggestions for now, I can provide vector image suggestions later if you like.
Use only a higher-end program (such as PhotoShop or FullShot) to capture raster images, such as screen shots
Use JPG or PNG only for photos and complex gradients, recommended 120 dpi
Be aware that the publishing program could distort JPG or PNG images, especially if they are updated with different tools, becuase it must interpret metadata like sizing and aliasing
Recommended for all other images (like screen shots): GIF format (use "save for web"), 72 dpi (alternatively 120 dpi if intended for printing)
The publishing program never seems to alter GIF images in any way (what you see is what you get)
So let's say you're having trouble with blurry screen shots. I would give GIF format and 72 dpi a try, and see how it publishes to PDF format. We had very good results with this.Just let me know if you need anything further. - paulmasalsky@...EMC
